questions.q: Which imaging modality is most appropriate for diagnosing acute pulmonary embolism?
questions.explanation: CT pulmonary angiogram is the gold standard for diagnosing acute pulmonary embolism due to its high sensitivity and specificity

questions.q: What is the most sensitive imaging technique for detecting early breast cancer?
questions.explanation: MRI has the highest sensitivity for detecting breast cancer, especially in dense breast tissue

questions.q: Regarding hot flushes in the menopausal period. All the following are true, EXCEPT :
questions.B: They are less in obese women.
questions.C: They are more in smoking women.

questions.q: Which of the following statement is INCORRECT:
questions.A: Climacteric is the phase during which a woman passes form the reproductive stage to non-reproductive stage.
questions.B: Pre-menopause is the time during climacteric during which the periods becomes irregular.
questions.C: Menopause is the final menstruation which occurs during the climacteric.
questions.D: Premature menopause is cessation of menstruation before the age of 40.
questions.E: Oral contraceptive pills delay the onset of menopause.

questions.q: True statement concerning the development of postmenopausal osteoporosis include:
questions.A: In typical patients, the yearly rate of bone loss remains constant.
questions.B: Estrogen replacement therapy is not effective in treatment.
questions.C: X-ray density of the wrist determines estrogen dosage.
questions.D: In most patients, fractures of trabecular bone occur earlier than fractures of cortical bone (e.g. Femur)

questions.q: The severity of menopausal vasomotor symptoms correlates best with:
questions.A: Mental status at the time if climacteric.

questions.q: Which of the following is NOT a physical finding associated with the climacteric:
Recognized feature of postmenopausal women is:
questions.E: Increase the incidence of uterine fibroid.

questions.q: After menopause: Which is true?
questions.A: There is increase in vaginal acidity
questions.C: Recurrent vaginal bleeding should be investigated by endometrial biopsy.
questions.D: Malignancy is the leading cause of post menopausal bleeding.

questions.q: All the following are possible causes of menorrhagia, EXCEPT
After menopause
questions.C: There is increase in bone density.
questions.D: The size of an existing fibroid increases.
questions.E: Any post menopausal bleeding should be investigated by endometrial sampling.

questions.q: Menorrhagia is:
questions.C: Heavy menstrual cycle more than 80 ml
questions.E: The main presentation in case of Asherman Syndrome

questions.q: An Obese 63-years old women present with a 3 month history of continuous scanty bleeding. Adequate history and physical examination what is your recommendation ?
questions.E: Official visit every 6month for the evaluation.

questions.q: Amount of blood loss during the normal menses :
Post menopausal bleeding :
questions.A: May be considered as a normal variation
questions.E: Atrophic vaginitis should not be considered for its very rare finding.

questions.q: All the following are possible causes of menorrhagia, EXCEPT
Which statement regarding menstrual abnormality is correct ?
questions.A: Menorrhagia is defined as a "frequent period".
questions.B: Bleeding due to uterine polyps is called dysfunctional uterine bleeding.
questions.C: Oligomenrrhia means periods with more than 35 days apart.
questions.E: Polymmenorrhea means periods that occur every 28 days

questions.q: Regarding Menorrhagia:
questions.A: Progesterone mediated IUCD can treat this condition.
questions.B: D & C is not required for diagnosis & management in a 40 years or more.
questions.C: In adolescent, it is important to rule out malignancy.
questions.D: Asherman syndrome is a main cause.
questions.E: It is defined as bleeding occurring every 2 weeks.
